ygData.subject: Re: Warning about Accelerando
ygData.msgSnippet: No you re right, it s not cheating, and they ll never ban someone for kiting, but it is frowned upon by those that cant do it and some who can ... From: jay
ygData.messageBody:
No you're right, it's not cheating, and they'll never ban someone for
kiting, but it is frowned upon by those that cant do it and some who can

-----Original Message-----
From: jay schultze [mailto:sartori69@...]
Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 2:14 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Warning about Accelerando


From: "jay schultze" <sartori69@...>



>From: David.Lynam@...
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Warning about Accelerando
>Date: Wed, 2 Jun 1999 20:05:54 +0100
>
>From: David.Lynam@...
>
>I know Crag Spiders move SLIGHTLY faster than you can run at an agility of
>100. However you can strafe run and move SLIGHTLY faster than they can.
>When you get bellow, for all of you lower level bards out there, it opens
>up
>a whole new world of cheating -=). Although it seems everyone has tried it
>at least once, it's generally frowned upon by non druids. But hey,
>sometimes there's no one to group with, especially during non peak hours.
>It's either that or wasting the night, awash with short beer. And by the
>way I am in no way advocating cheating. You simply must find ways to play
>smarter as a bard.
>
>-----Original Message-----
>From: John Kim [mailto:kim@...]
>Sent: Wednesday, June 02, 1999 1:59 PM
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: Re: [eqbards] Warning about Accelerando
>
>
>From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
>Those of you who play only a bard may not have noticed that
>giant scarabs and goblins (at least the low-level ones) move
>slower than you can normally run.
>
>--
>John H. Kim
>kim@...
>

I personally don't kite creatures to death, i think it's cheap and cheesy,
but I don't think it's cheating.
I am usually the person designated to pull mobs, and I will bellow the
creature as much as possible on the way in to my party so that it is hurt
before it ever arrives. I never come close to killing it, but sometimes have

been able to knock a quarter of its hit points off.

Sartori D'Elsiraad
Bard of Kelethin of the 15th Chorus
Veeshan
